metadata.title: CVE-2017-17044 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.9.x allowing HVM guest OS users tocause a denial of service (infinite loop and host OS hang) by leveragingthe mishandling of Populate on Demand (PoD) errors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17044` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenevtchn1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxengnttab1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenhypfs1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenmisc4.17 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxenstore4 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxentoolcore1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
libxentoollog1 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-4.17-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-system-armhf - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-utils-4.17 - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xen-utils-common - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
xenstore-utils - 4.9.2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.9.2-0ubuntu1').
